p: Regarding non-respiratory virus infections, double-blind randomized trial was performed to confirm the action of Myrtus communis against human papillomavirus (HPV). Herbal vaginal suppositories containing 0.5% of myrtle essential oil were prescribed for the intervention group and showed greater number of negative HPV tests (92.6%) after treatment when compared to the placebo group (62.6%). In addition, an improvement in the size of the cervical lesion was also observed (Nikakhtar et al. 2018).
